cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 205 mi ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest but slowing, then turning west-northwest tonight and west to west-southwest on Friday and Saturday, drifting slowly inland across eastern South Carolina and then into Georgia early next week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern North Carolina / northern South Carolina coast (near Wilmington-Myrtle Beach)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from South Santee River SC to Duck NC; Tropical Storm Warning north of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coasts of North Carolina and South Carolina with storm-surge 2–13 ft; tropical-storm winds extending into Georgia coast including Savannah within 3–5 days
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–47 kt) possible late Friday through Sunday; 15% chance of 50-kt winds, very low chance of hurricane-force winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding (1–3 ft) possible if the center drifts closer to the Georgia coast, but no significant surge currently forecast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could produce 4–8 inches with locally higher totals, creating flash-flood risk in coastal Georgia.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; dangerous rip currents and rough seas affecting vessel approaches.
